snippet: The F.D.A. on Tuesday made the most widely known morning-after pill available without a prescription to girls and women ages 15 and older.
abstract: Food and Drug Administration says that it will make most widely known morning-after pill Plan B One-Step available without prescription to girls and women ages 15 and older; pill will be available on drugstore shelves, instead of locked up behind pharmacy counters.
lead_paragraph: The F.D.A. on Tuesday made the most widely known morning-after pill available without a prescription to girls and women ages 15 and older.

headline.seo: F.D.A. Lowers Age for Morning-After Pill
headline.main: Drug Agency Lowers Age for Next-Day Birth Control
headline.print_headline: Drug Agency Lowers Age For Next-Day Birth Control
